title: Yellowtommhe
author: Yellowtommhe
created_time: February 23, 2023, 02:35:43 PMLast edit: February 23, 2023, 04:51:44 PM by Yellowtommhe
content: Is there any local p2p site / group? I am looking for a small trade selling btc for cash or mbway cash code in Porto. Unfortunateley I put myself in a little dumb situation and need to get like 50€ in cash to get by for a few days.If anyone would be so kind to help me out with a quick trade, you can find the listing on agoradesk and localcoinswap as well.Thank you./edit luckily this is not needed anymore but damn p2p especially locally seems absolute dead.

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: Quote from: Yellowtommhe on February 23, 2023, 02:35:43 PM/edit luckily this is not needed anymore but damn p2p especially locally seems absolute dead.AFAIK, @joker_josue is the only Portuguese active here. Sadly, the board hasn't gotten a lot of love in some time. Falando em inglês por que foi assim que o OP começou... vai que ele é um "gringo" passeando/morando em Porto?

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: Yellowtommhe on February 23, 2023, 02:35:43 PM/edit luckily this is not needed anymore but damn p2p especially locally seems absolute dead.Sorry for not replying sooner. This weekend I was sick, and that's why I came to the forum very few times.The Portuguese market is not very famous in P2P for almost 8 years. Since most BTC holders are very suspicious.I'm not from Porto either, so it wouldn't be easy to help. But maybe the MB Way could...Either way, if you need help again, come back to the forum.---Tambem escrevi em Ingles, para o OP poder ler mais facilmente a resposta.

comments.author: riclas
comments.body: ping me if you ever need p2p

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: Yellowtommhe on February 23, 2023, 02:35:43 PM/edit luckily this is not needed anymore but damn p2p especially locally seems absolute dead.This is not the best board for p2p.You should visit this board. comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: riclas on March 05, 2023, 05:03:30 PMping me if you ever need p2p Tens algum canal de serviço P2P?Como costuma trabalhar? MB Way?

comments.author: riclas
comments.body: provavelmente estamos a falar de p2p diferentes.respodendo à tua pergunta, sou um dos fundadores da lusodigitalassets.com e estamos prestes a abrir a nossa plataforma online com compras por transferência bancária e mbway

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: riclas on March 06, 2023, 10:54:53 PMprovavelmente estamos a falar de p2p diferentes.respodendo à tua pergunta, sou um dos fundadores da lusodigitalassets.com e estamos prestes a abrir a nossa plataforma online com compras por transferência bancária e mbwayBoa!Quando falo em P2P é algo sem KYC, que acredito que irá ter um aumento de procura ao longo deste ano.Como vai funcionar essa nova plataforma? Se é que podes dar mais alguns detalhes.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on March 07, 2023, 12:10:54 AMQuando falo em P2P é algo sem KYC, que acredito que irá ter um aumento de procura ao longo deste ano.Como vai funcionar essa nova plataforma? Se é que podes dar mais alguns detalhes. Embora formalmente não tenha esse nome kyc, o comprador p2p está sempre identificado Qualquer transferência bancária envolve identificação da sua identidade,  e além disso as operações são usualmente reportadas pelo vendedor aos órgãos do governo, por questões de interesse do próprio vendedor.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: bitmover on March 08, 2023, 01:06:36 PMEmbora formalmente não tenha esse nome kyc, o comprador p2p está sempre identificado Qualquer transferência bancária envolve identificação da sua identidade,  e além disso as operações são usualmente reportadas pelo vendedor aos órgãos do governo, por questões de interesse do próprio vendedor. Isso sim... mas quando falo em P2P é a transação feita por dois particulares, que apenas trocam dinheiro por um bem, que neste caso é BTC. Claro que se o "vendedor" tem um negocio tem de declarar. Mas, se não tiver pode fazer tudo sem esses reportes.Digamos que falo do P2P puro e duro, a moda antiga.

Sim, vou ficar aqui por 5 meses :-)Thank you for the replys, if I need something again I know where to look.Oh and my apologies for writing the initial topic in english I just thought that would be better than my 17 words of portuguese or google translate

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.body: Quote from: Yellowtommhe on April 04, 2023, 07:58:19 AMSim, vou ficar aqui por 5 meses :-)Thank you for the replys, if I need something again I know where to look.Oh and my apologies for writing the initial topic in english I just thought that would be better than my 17 words of portuguese or google translate Although this the chances are very slim, you can use the option "face to face[1]" in Bisq[2] to see if any offer is being made around Porto (but I don't they will appear there sadly). So far I was only able to find an offer selling bitcoin for cash (F2F) in Lisbon through localcoinswap[3], but it appears you aren't located there as of now. But if you do consider going there perhaps consider buying a relative large amount to prevent such circumstances in the future? The minimum amount the seller is asking is 250€ while asking for a 10% above market prices.[1]https://bisq.wiki/Face-to-face_(payment_method)[2]https://bisq.network/[3]https://localcoinswap.com/buy/bitcoin/portugal/cash-in-person

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.body: While in the subject for P2P, yesterday there was a meetup in Lisbon[1] where anyone would be able to exchange bitcoin for cash. I'm also aware that they promoted a meeting of Peach Bitcoin app wallet[2] which recently opened up their thread here on bitcointalk[3]. They will probably do it again in a couple of weeks, so I guess that the best thing to do is keep a track on their meetings and prepare for those sweet P2P trades, just like Satoshi envisioned.[1]https://www.bitcoinerevents.com/event/bitcoin-in-africa-lisbon-bitcoin-maximalists/[2]https://peachbitcoin.com/[3]https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5448414.0
